column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I found myself engaged in a painting for awhile today at the art institute. Edouard Vuillard's "Room at the Chateau des Chapes" (that above is by him
column2: but not painting) drew me in and I stood for long minutes imaging the way the light fell and the days went there. Perhaps it was more the room
column3: I could have lived there. Nothing was planned
column4: all was functional yet it was obviously done by the hand of man
column5: not God or an interior designer. Possessions were where they fall naturally
column6: nothing was clever or arranged to effect. And through each item I learned more about the painter and wanted to break the frame really
column7: roll up the canvas and make room for it on my wall.
